intro: Moricandia rytidocarpoides, commonly known as the desert mustache, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Central Asia. It is a low-growing annual herb with slender, branched stems and small, pale green leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It has adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments through features like reduced leaf surface and deep root systems. Moricandia rytidocarpoides is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is part of the Brassicaceae family.
